security: Disclosing the specific targets and methods of intelligence gathering can compromise ongoing operations and potentially expose individuals providing information.
summary: A cable concerning SILENCE C and mentioning individuals Richard Walker and Lloyd George, as well as internal CIA staff, related to the KAPOK LCHARVEST operation in Mexico City.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET cable, dated 12 October 1963, references the SILENCE C project and mentions the KAPOK LCHARVEST operation in Mexico City. The cable is addressed to RECIOR and includes distribution to various CIA departments (OOP, C/CI, C/FI, C/WH, D/OS, RF, VR). It also references individuals such as Richard Walker (Chairman, Department of International Relations, University of South Carolina) and FI Staff Lloyd George (by phone), along with Steve Ross (DO/PSD/OS) and Mr. Morris (CI Staff), indicating coordination and information sharing within the agency.
title: SILENCE C 201-730731
